dublin_core.dcvalue: Bubbles in the ocular tear film have been observed following both dry chamber simulated compressed air dives and in water recreational compressed air dives The current paper reports on the formation of tear film bubbles in a breath hold diver following repeated extended breath hold excursions to a maximum depth of 28 5 m It is believed that this is the first time that ocular tear film bubbles have been reported in breath hold divers
Undersea And hyperbaric medicine : journal of the Undersea and Hyperbaric Medical Society, Inc
Ocular tear film bubble formation after breath-hold diving.
